message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hypospadias is a congenital condition where the opening of the urethra is located on the underside of the penis instead of at the tip. It results from failure of the urethral folds to fuse, not the genital folds. It is not associated with younger maternal age or timing of repair, but urethrocutaneous fistula is a known complication of surgery. The urethral anatomy is formed before the 12th week of intrauterine development.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hypospadias is a congenital condition where the opening of the urethra is not at the tip of the penis but on the underside of the penis. The correct statement among the options is that it results from failure of the genital folds to fuse during fetal development. Younger age of the mother is not a major risk factor, hypospadias repair is associated with a decreased incidence of urethrocutaneous fistula, and the anatomy is formed before the 12th week of intrauterine development.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The ventral urethral meatus inferior to the glans is indicative of hypospadias, which results from failure of the genital folds to fuse during embryonic development. Younger age of the mother is not a major risk factor, and hypospadias repair before the age of 3 years is associated with decreased incidence of urethrocutaneous fistula. The formation of such anatomy occurs during the 9th to 12th week of intrauterine development.

It is not associated with the age of the mother, and hypospadias repair before the age of 3 years is actually associated with a decreased incidence of urethrocutaneous fistula. The anatomy is formed before the 12th week of intrauterine development.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hypospadias is a common congenital abnormality where the opening of the urethra is on the ventral side of the penis rather than at the tip. Option (C) is correct as the anatomy of the urethral meatus is formed before the 12th week of intrauterine development. Option (A) is incorrect as maternal age is not a risk factor for this condition. Option (B) is also incorrect as the repair of hypospadias before the age of 3 years may decrease the incidence of urethrocutaneous fistula. Option (D) is correct as hypospadias is caused by failed fusion of the genital folds during fetal development.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hypospadias is a congenital condition where the urethral meatus is located ventral to its normal position. It results from failure of the urethral folds to fuse, which normally occurs between the 8th and 12th week of intrauterine development. Younger age of the mother is not a risk factor for hypospadias, and hypospadias repair before the age of 3 years is not associated with increased incidence of urethrocutaneous fistula.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hypospadias is a congenital condition where the urethral meatus is located on the ventral surface of the penis and occurs due to the failure of the urethral folds to close. Option A is incorrect as maternal age is not a known risk factor for hypospadias. Option B is incorrect as repair before the age of 3 years is associated with a decreased incidence of complications. Option C is incorrect as hypospadias formation occurs between weeks 8 and 14 of intrauterine development.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Hypospadias is a condition where the urethral meatus is located on the ventral side of the penis instead of the tip. Option (A) is incorrect, as advanced maternal age is a risk factor for genetic abnormalities but not for hypospadias. Option (B) is incorrect, as there is no significant association between the timing of hypospadias repair and the incidence of urethrocutaneous fistula. Option (C) is incorrect, as the urethral development occurs between the 4th and 12th week of intrauterine life. The correct answer is (D) as hypospadias results from failure of the genital folds to fuse during fetal development.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Ventral urethral meatus is a characteristic feature of hypospadias, which results from failure of the genital folds to fuse during embryonic development. Younger age of the mother is not a major risk factor for this condition, and hypospadias repair before the age of 3 years is actually associated with a decreased incidence of urethrocutaneous fistula. The formation of such anatomy occurs during the 9th to 11th weeks of intrauterine development.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The anatomy described suggests hypospadias, which is caused by failure of the urethral folds to completely fuse during embryonic development (option D). Younger age of the mother is not a known risk factor for this condition (option A). Hypospadias repair before the age of 3 years is associated with a lower incidence of urethrocutaneous fistula (option B). The urogenital sinus, from which the urethra, bladder, and vagina develop, begins to form in the 3rd week of intrauterine development and the urethral folds begin to form in the 4th week (option C).
